event.title: a 9 percent decrease from 155 at the 2000

data.event: The population was 141 at the 2010 census, a 9 percent decrease from 155 at the 2000 census.
Burbank was founded in 1903 on the Osage Indian Reservation.
Burbank had about 200 residents and an economy based on farming and ranching until May 1920 when E.W. Marland discovered petroleum northeast of the town.
Oil production in the Burbank field expanded from 134,408 barrels in 1920 to a peak production of 26,206,741 barrels in 1923.

event.title: a peak production of 26,206,741 barrels in 1923

data.event: Oil production in the Burbank field expanded from 134,408 barrels in 1920 to a peak production of 26,206,741 barrels in 1923.
Production dropped by one-half in 1926 and by 1930 the boom period was over.
